channel.title: Managing and running your server with an IDE
channel.description:
[center]I'm sick and tired of people posting help threads about compiling issues that were solved like years ago. It is very simple guys...
I recommend using an IDE. Such as Eclipse or IDEA. Usually these come with a built-in compiler. Eclipse auto-builds. I haven't used IDEA but I've heard good of it. And Netbeans, never really heard of it, just know its good. Here are some basic IDE features:
[ul][li]Build-in compiler[/li] [li]Build in run[/li] [li]Text editor[/li] [li]Usually come with a console for errors/warnings[/li] [li]Many other great things[/li][/ul]
-Some Java IDE Applications- [url=http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/][ECLIPSE][/url] [url=http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/][INTELLIJ IDEA][/url] [url=http://download.netbeans.org/netbeans/6.1/final/][NETBEANS][/url] [url=http://www.codegear.com/products/jbuilder][JBUILDER][/url]
(NOTE: The only one i've tested is Eclipse, I'm 100% sure they are all clean!)
THESE DO NOT FIX YOUR RETARDED AND OR STUPID CODING FAULTS!
[size=20pt] ~IMPORTING YOUR SERVER INTO ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]
1. Open eclipse and go to File > New > Java Project (If it isn't there, go to File > New > Project then select 'Java project') [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/1.jpg[/img]
2. Enter your project name in the box: [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/2.jpg[/img]
3. Select to use an existing source. [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/3.jpg[/img]
4. Locate your server folder and click 'OK' [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/4.jpg[/img]
5. Click 'Finish' [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/5.jpg[/img]
[size=20pt]~MANAGING YOUR SERVER IN ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]
1. Open your server folder in the hierarchy [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/6.jpg[/img]
2. Drop down the 'Default Package' drop down from the hierarcy [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/6.jpg[/img]
3. Select the file you want to open from the hierarchy. It will appear in the editor [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/7.jpg[/img]
NOTE: You can view the console at any time to view errors and warnings. Your server is bound to come with at least 100 warnings.
[size=20pt]~RUNNING YOUR SERVER WITH ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]
1. Right click on your server folder and select Run as > Java Application [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/gagaga.jpg[/img]
2. Select the 'server (default package)' from the menu [IMG]http://i310.photobucket.com/albums/kk426/Zhaedara/Eclipse%20howto/8.jpg[/img]
3. Enjoy.[/center]

@dantotman wrote:

[quote=“Zhaedara, post:1, topic:226097”][quote author=dantotman link=topic=297034.msg2386970#msg2386970 date=1218816260]

THESE DO NOT FIX YOUR RETARDED AND OR STUPID CODING ERRORS!

^ whats the point in posting it then?
[/quote]
Invalid path specified, ‘javac’ cannot be recognized as an internal or external command, jdk could not be found, etc.[/quote]
well is jdk can’t be found dnt that tell u, u aint installed it or just stupid and havent clicked on “setup.exe”?

Read full topic

item.title: Managing and running your server with an IDE
item.dc:creator: @Zhaedara Zhaedara
item.description:
@Zhaedara wrote:

[center]I’m sick and tired of people posting help threads about compiling issues that were solved like years ago. It is very simple guys…

I recommend using an IDE. Such as Eclipse or IDEA. Usually these come with a built-in compiler. Eclipse auto-builds. I haven’t used IDEA but I’ve heard good of it. And Netbeans, never really heard of it, just know its good. Here are some basic IDE features:

[ul][li]Build-in compiler[/li]
[li]Build in run[/li]
[li]Text editor[/li]
[li]Usually come with a console for errors/warnings[/li]
[li]Many other great things[/li][/ul]

-Some Java IDE Applications-
[ECLIPSE]
[INTELLIJ IDEA]
[NETBEANS]
[JBUILDER]

(NOTE: The only one i’ve tested is Eclipse, I’m 100% sure they are all clean!)

THESE DO NOT FIX YOUR RETARDED AND OR STUPID CODING FAULTS!

[size=20pt]
~IMPORTING YOUR SERVER INTO ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]

  1. Open eclipse and go to File > New > Java Project (If it isn’t there, go to File > New > Project then select ‘Java project’)

  2. Enter your project name in the box:

  3. Select to use an existing source.

  4. Locate your server folder and click ‘OK’

  5. Click ‘Finish’

[size=20pt]~MANAGING YOUR SERVER IN ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]

  1. Open your server folder in the hierarchy

  2. Drop down the ‘Default Package’ drop down from the hierarcy

  3. Select the file you want to open from the hierarchy. It will appear in the editor

NOTE: You can view the console at any time to view errors and warnings. Your server is bound to come with at least 100 warnings.

[size=20pt]~RUNNING YOUR SERVER WITH ECLIPSE IDE~[/size]

  1. Right click on your server folder and select Run as > Java Application

    gagaga.jpg1024×768

  2. Select the ‘server (default package)’ from the menu

  3. Enjoy.[/center]

Read full topic
